import React from 'react'; import '../Duties.css'; import Navbar from './Navbar'; import Footer from './Footer'; export default function Duty10() { return ( <>

Fundamental Duty 10: Strive for Excellence

Article 51A(j) - The pursuit of excellence in all endeavors

🧩 Comprehensive Understanding

Article 51A(j) establishes an aspirational obligation for citizens to:

  • Individual Excellence: Pursue personal growth and skill development
  • Collective Excellence: Contribute to societal progress and national development
  • Professional Excellence: Maintain high standards in all occupations
  • Civic Excellence: Participate meaningfully in democratic processes

This duty connects with constitutional values of dignity (Article 21) and equal opportunity (Article 14).

📖 Detailed Explanation

The constitutional framework for this duty includes:

  • Educational Framework:
    • Right to Education Act's quality standards
    • National Skill Development Mission
    • Institutions like IITs, IIMs, and AIIMS
  • Policy Mechanisms:
    • National Education Policy 2020's excellence focus
    • Startup India and Make in India initiatives
    • Quality councils and accreditation bodies
  • Recognition Systems:
    • National awards for excellence in various fields
    • Padma awards for exceptional service
    • Sports and cultural excellence programs

📜 Historical Context

This duty emerged from:

  • Post-Independence Vision:
    • Nehru's emphasis on scientific temper and progress
    • Ambedkar's focus on education and social mobility
  • Economic Reforms:
    • Liberalization era's competitive demands
    • Globalization's quality standards
  • Constitutional Evolution:
    • 42nd Amendment (1976) during national development push
    • Complementary to DPSP Article 38 (welfare state)

🏛️ Judicial Interpretations

  • TMA Pai Foundation v. State of Karnataka (2002) : Linked educational excellence with fundamental rights. [(2002) 8 SCC 481]
  • Unni Krishnan v. State of AP (1993) : Recognized quality education as part of right to life. [AIR 1993 SC 2178]
  • Confederation of Ex-Servicemen v. Union of India (2006) : Upheld merit-based appointments as constitutional requirement. [(2006) 8 SCC 399]

🔍 Contemporary Relevance

  • Global competitiveness in knowledge economy
  • Quality standards in public services
  • Ethical dimensions of professional excellence
  • Promoting research and innovation culture
  • Balancing excellence with equity concerns
); }
